t: A*p prophecy against Moab: Ar*pn in Moab is ruined, destroyed*ld in a night! Kir*ln in Moab is ruined, destroyed*ld in a night!
Dibon*ln goes up to its temple, to*ld its high places to weep; Moab*ld wails over Nebo and Medeba. Every*ln head is shaved and*ld every beard cut off.
In*ln the streets they wear sackcloth; on*ld the roofs and in the public squares they*ln all wail, prostrate*ld with weeping.
Heshbon*ln and Elealeh cry out, their*ld voices are heard all the way to Jahaz. Therefore*ln the armed men of Moab cry out, and*ld their hearts are faint.

My*pn heart cries out over Moab; her*ld fugitives flee as far as Zoar, as*ld far as Eglath Shelishiyah. They*ln go up the hill to Luhith, weeping*ld as they go; on*ln the road to Horonaim they*ld lament their destruction.
The*ln waters of Nimrim are dried up and*ld the grass is withered; the*ln vegetation is gone and*ld nothing green is left.
So*ln the wealth they have acquired and stored up they*ld carry away over the Ravine of the Poplars.
Their*ln outcry echoes along the border of Moab; their*ld wailing reaches as far as Eglaim, their*ld lamentation as far as Beer Elim.
The*ln waters of Dimon are full of blood, but*ld I will bring still more upon Dimonâ€” a*ln lion upon the fugitives of Moab and*ld upon those who remain in the land.
